results.title: Miller's Crossing
results.creator_credit: Circle Films, Ethan Coen and Joel Coen
results.brief_description: Millers Crossing contains all the elements of the classic gangster cliches of this genre: fast women, guns and booze. The Coen brothers however have produced a film which is both “stylish and seamless”, and a “hero” who is both a man of principle and a murderer. Starring Albert Finney, Gabriel Byrne and Marcia Gay Harden, “Millers Crossing” tells the tale of Leo, a benevolent Irish gangster and his trusted lieutenant Tom Reagan. Their control is being threatened by the ever-increasing presence of the “Italians”. Caught in the grips of a gangland struggle, Tom must walk a tightrope as he tries to control and manipulate the outcome. The Coen’s have recreated the look and feel of the gangster era with stunning cinematography and a thrilling plot.

results.title: Mildred Pierce
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jerry Wald and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Joan Crawford earned an Academy Award for her portrayal of Mildred Pierce, a mother who devotes her whole life to her two daughters. When Mildred’s husband turns to another woman for solace, she divorces him and opens a successful restaurant, however, when their eldest daughter’s selfishness gets out of hand, both mother and daughter must face the tragic consequences. Also stars Eve Arden, Ann Blyth, Jack Carson and Zachary Scott.

results.title: Mikey and Nicky
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Bud Austin and Elaine May
results.brief_description: Screen legends John Cassavetes and Peter Falk are Mikey and Nicky, friends since childhood. Their friendship is forcefully renewed when small-time hood Nicky (Cassavetes), seeks out his friend Mikey (Falk), when he fears there is a hit on him. His suspicions are correct, with hitman Kinney (Ned Beatty) on his tail. When Mikey and Nicky are on the run one witnesses the unravelling of their friendship as suspicion, resentment and betrayal surfaces. Cassavetes and Falk revel in each others performances and there is fine support from Ned Beatty, Rose Arrick and Carol Grace.

results.title: Mighty Ducks 2
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Jordan Kerner, Jon Avnet and Sam Weisman
results.brief_description: Emilio Estevez returns in another heartwarming comedy about the Mighty Ducks; an ice-hockey team full of misfit teenagers with the desire to be the best they can be. The team win an opportunity to represent their country in the Junior Goodwill Games to be held in Los Angeles. Two challenges await them - the fierce competition in the form of the team from Iceland and resisting the Hollywood glitz and glamour which threatens to tear them apart. Only team spirit will help them overcome these obstacles.

results.title: Mighty Aphrodite
results.creator_credit: Magnolia Productions, Sweetland Films BV, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller.

results.title: Midnight in the garden of good and evil
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Arnold Stiefel and Clint Eastwood
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood directed this adaptation of John Berendt’s non-fiction best-seller about a Savannah, Georgia, murder case. As the film begins, New York journalist, John Kelso (John Cusack), arrives in Savannah to do a brief article on the annual Christmas party given by sophisticated, urbane antique dealer, Jim Williams (Kevin Spacey). After the party, Williams kills his violent lover, Billy, explaining it as self defence. Kelso decides to stay in Savannah to cover the trial, encountering a variety of colourful locals and eccentrics. Cast includes Kevin Spacey, John Cusack, Jack Thompson, Alison Eastwood and Jude Law.

results.title: Midnight express [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Casablanca Films, David Puttnam and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: A young tourist, Billy Hayes (Brad Davis), travelling in Turkey is arrested for possession of hashish. The film traces his experiences, often violent and terrifying, in a foreign jail and his attempts to escape and cross the border into freedom. The cast also features John Hurt and Randy Quaid with a script by Oliver Stone. The film is based on Billy Hughes’ book of the same title relating his jail experiences.

results.title: Midnight dancers = Sibak
results.brief_description: This low-budget portrait of three brothers who make a living in Manila as “Macho Dancers” or “sibak” (a slang term for male prostitutes), filmed in the streets and in the bars of Manila, offers a rare insight into gay culture in the Philippines. The eldest, who at 23 is verging on being too old for his profession, has a wife and child but is also openly involved with a wealthy older man. The second brother lives a life on the streets selling his body while attempting to avoid the violently homophobic police. Against the admonishments of his mother, the youngest travels to the city to join his brothers in the sex trade. He soon becomes romantically involved with a transvestite and they begin a steady relationship. Faced with the harsh reality of poverty, their mother is forced to accept her sons efforts to support the family. Although the direction and performances are uneven, and the voyeuristic focus on the dancers lithe bodies overly gratuitous the film is an indictment of the abhorrent conditions of crime, poverty and homophobia faced by sex workers in the Philippines. Cast: Ryan Aristorenas, Perla Bautista, Richard Cassity.

results.title: Midnight cowboy
results.creator_credit: Jerome Hellman-John Schlesinger Productions, Jerome Hellman and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Tough, potent and shocking; an haunting look at the American Dream - turned nightmare. As Ratso Rizzo, scrounging, sleazy small-time con-man with big dreams, Dustin Hoffman gives one of the most unforgettable performances of his career. And as Joe Buck, the good-looking, naively charming Texas “cowboy” convinced that he is the salvation of many lonely, love-starved New York women, Jon Voight is magnificent. Living on the tattered fringe of society, an unlikely bond grows between these two outcasts that is powerful and poignant. From first frame to last, this multi-award winning film is a transcendant, compassionate film masterpiece that hits right at the heart.

results.title: Midaq Alley = El Callejon de los Milagros
results.creator_credit: Alameda Films, Instituto Mexicano de Cinematografia, Alfredo Ripstein Jr and Jorge Fons
results.brief_description: Set in a poor section of downtown Mexico City, “Midaq Alley” is a story of several characters, each with their own story to tell, and each bound together inextricably by their inhabitance of this rather rundown derelict neighbourhood. The film is broken up into four separate tales which all intertwine and connect with each other. The first tale “Rutilio” introduces a middle-aged owner of a small bar in the town. Rutilio (Ernesto Gomez Cruz), estranged from his wife and family is about to embark on an affair, the consequences of which will have a devastating effect on his family particularly his son, Chava. The second tale “Alma” is about a young, beautiful and rather naive girl, Alma (Selma Hayek) who is patiently waiting for the return of her fiance Abel (Bruno Bichir) from the United States. Abel has gone to the States to make money so he can come back and marry Alma. Life however becomes complicated for Alma and feeling lonely and missing Abel, she finds herself attracted to the attentions of the suave but rather unsavoury Jose Luis (Daniel Gimenez Cacho). Her life is about to be changed forever. The third story “Susanita” tells of the spinster landlady of a small apartment block in the neighbourhood who longs for romance in her rather sad and lonely life. Susanita (Margarita Sanz) unwittingly and tragically ends up in a “sham” marriage. “El Regreso” (The Return), the fourth story, ties up all the plot threads of romance, deceit, human frailty, sadness and despair into one final act. Based on the novel by Egyptian writer and Nobel prize winner, Naguib Mahfuz, and winner of 45 international film awards, including Berlin and Chicago, this is a fine film with an excellent supporting cast including Maria Rojo, Delia Casanova, Claudio Obregon, Juan Manuel Bernal.
